intro: Hydrosme longituberosa, commonly known as the long-tubed hydrosme, is a rare and unique aquatic plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, tuberous roots and its ability to thrive in slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant has finely divided, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface, aiding in photosynthesis. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-white in color, and appear in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hydrosme longituberosa is considered a species of conservation concern.
